item.description:
7 pm – Nan Doyle


---------------------------


An organization catalyst and clever bridge-builder, Nan Doyle thrives at the intersection of her three “tri” passions: life science, business, and arts/culture, the root behind the name of her company, Trillium Advisors. Ms. Doyle facilitates and implements strategic and business plans; life-science technology transfer, business development and partnering; market and audience research; fundraising; community outreach; and development campaigns for U.S. and ex-U.S. organizations. An enthusiastic ambassador for Boston, her community advocacy extends to the Arts & Business Council of Greater Boston, Boston Historical Society, and Community Boating Boston. Ms. Doyle received her B.S. from the University of Delaware and M.S from Boston University.


Her previous positions include:

Director of Development for the Biomedical Research Institute at Brigham and Women’s Hospital.

Associate Vice President at the Museum of Science, Boston

Director of Corporate Development for Genzyme Corporation


-----------------------------


8 pm – General Meeting

Come join us for our Professional Development Speaker and regularly scheduled meeting. We allot roughly 45 minutes for each speaker (usually 30 minutes for presentation and 15 minutes Q&A) then we begin the meeting at 8pm and discuss all the exciting happenings of the club! Come for one event, or both! All are welcome, so please feel free to bring a friend! We will likely head out for a drink or two after the meeting, so plan to make a night of it! :D
item.how_to_find_us: Walk into 116 Beacon, down the hall & take the stairs on the left going down. Follow the signs for Boston Rotaract to the Trustee's Reading Room (TRR)!

group.name: Boston Rotaract - A Service/Social Club for 18-30 Yr Olds

item.name: Boston Rotaract Speaker and General Meeting
